These ClassMethods are mixed-in to ActiveRecord and are available to all ActiveRecord models.

Methods

has_many_telephones  

Public Instance methods

has_many_telephones()

By using ‘has_many_telephones’ in your models, you will receive all of the usual Rails ‘has_many’ methods plus additional Class and Instance methods as described herein.

The class method ‘find_all_by_telephone’ will allow you to quickly find instances of that model with the provided telephone number. e.g. 

  class Organization < ActiveRecord::Base
    has_many_telephones
  end

  Organization.find_all_by_telephone('1234567890') => an array of Organizations with the telephone number '1234567890'.

Note that this method will retun an empty array if no instances are found.
